title: React Native Expo Mobile Client POC
description:
## Mission

Build a minimal proof-of-concept React Native mobile app using Expo that connects to the Claudet server to send messages and receive AI replies.

## Scope (minimal POC only)

- Single screen with a text input box
- Send button to submit a message
- Display area to show the AI reply
- No sessions, no history, no settings, no auth

## Workaround

If Bun and Expo tooling have compatibility issues (Expo CLI often requires Node.js), migrate the mobile project setup to Node.js and npm. The existing server (Bun) stays as-is — only the mobile dev tooling changes. This is expected and fine.

## Server Connection

The Claudet server exposes POST /api/chat for sending messages. The Expo app should call this endpoint. Note: the server uses HTTPS with self-signed certs in dev — if this causes React Native connection issues, add a plain HTTP option or similar workaround.

## Structure

Mobile app lives in mobile/ subdirectory, completely separate from the main Bun project.
close_reason: POC complete and working: Expo app connects to server, sends messages, receives replies

title: Add HTTP-compatible chat endpoint to server
description:
## Goal

Ensure the Claudet server has an HTTP-accessible /api/chat endpoint for the mobile client.

## Problem

The dev server runs HTTPS with self-signed certs. React Native (Expo) will reject self-signed certs by default, making development painful.

## Solution

Add a secondary HTTP server on a different port (e.g. 3001) that proxies or directly handles /api/chat requests. This is dev-only — prod can stay HTTPS.

Alternatively, if React Native allows insecure HTTP in dev mode (via app.json or Info.plist flags), document that instead.

## Notes

- Keep existing HTTPS server unchanged
- Only add what's needed for mobile dev connectivity
- Parent feature: claudet-8ot (React Native Expo Mobile Client POC)
close_reason: Added plain HTTP server on port 3001 with /api/chat POST and /api/sessions POST endpoints for mobile client

title: Build minimal chat UI in Expo app
description:
## Goal

Build the single-screen chat UI in the Expo app.

## Requirements

- Text input for typing a message
- Send button
- Area to display the AI reply (last reply only is fine for POC)
- Loading state while waiting for response

## Implementation

- Single App.tsx or screens/Chat.tsx file
- Use React Native's TextInput, TouchableOpacity/Pressable, Text, View
- POST to http://<host>:3001/api/chat (HTTP endpoint from sibling task)
- Body: JSON with { message: string, sessionId: string }
- Display response.content from the API reply

## Notes

- No navigation needed — single screen
- No state management library — useState is enough
- Parent feature: claudet-8ot (React Native Expo Mobile Client POC)
close_reason: Built minimal chat UI in mobile/App.tsx: session creation on mount, message send via POST /api/chat, reply display, loading/error states

title: Move server session data to local SQLite DB using Bun builtins
description:
Migrate server-side session data storage from current implementation to a local SQLite database using Bun's built-in bun:sqlite module.

## Goals
- Replace current session data storage with SQLite persistence
- Use Bun's native bun:sqlite for zero-dependency DB access
- Ensure session data survives server restarts
- Maintain existing session API contracts

## Implementation Notes
- Use Bun.file() and bun:sqlite APIs
- Define schema for sessions table (id, created_at, updated_at, data, etc.)
- Add migration support for schema changes
- Consider WAL mode for better concurrent read performance
